clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Experimental and Commercial Air-Activated, Adhesive Backed Heat Patches
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Experimental and Commercial Air-Activated, Adhesive Backed Heat Patches

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the safety and tolerability for the extended wear of an experimental air-activated self adhesive patch.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: A trained skin grader will apply a predetermined scale to the observed skin reactions in the test areas under light supplied by a 100-watt incandescent blue bulb.

secondary_outcome.description: Adhesion will be evaluated to a predetermined scale when the subjects return for visits; after approximately 8 hours of wear time.

other_outcome.description: Assessed using thermocouple sensors worn between the patch and subject's skin with readings taken every 15 minutes.

arm_group.description: Group of subjects wearing comparative predicate device for 8 hours daily for 7 days.
Group of subjects wearing the experimental patch for 8 hours daily for 7 days.
Group of subjects wearing the placebo patch for 8 hours daily for 7 days.
